name: GCP for Those That Speak AWS
description:
So you know AWS pretty well, but what is this Google Cloud thing? Join us for the inaugural meeting of the Portland Google Cloud Platform Meetup Group with a session on demystifying Google Cloud by resident Googler, Mike Graboski. 

There will be fellow Googlers attending so please come meet us and check out our Portland office in the Wells Fargo Building downtown. And, most important, there will be local brew and snacks available. 

We are looking forward to meeting everyone!
how_to_find_us: Google Portland 309 SW 6th Ave, Portland, OR 97204

name: BigData with BigQuery - the Data Warehousing for analytics at any scale
description:
• What we'll do
Please come join us for a walk-through about BigQuery and how this service can help companies of all sizes. There will be multiple Googlers to help answer questions and work with you. This will be held in the Google office downtown. Looking forward to connecting!

Snacks and beverages will be provided. "BigQuery is Google's serverless, highly scalable, low cost enterprise data warehouse designed to make all your data analysts productive. Because there is no infrastructure to manage, you can focus on analyzing data to find meaningful insights using familiar SQL and you don't need a database administrator. BigQuery enables you to analyze all your data by creating a logical data warehouse over managed, columnar storage as well as data from object storage, and spreadsheets."

• What to bring

• Important to know
how_to_find_us: Come up to the 4th floor and check in at reception

name: Extracting Java Microservices with Kubernetes
description:
Join Google Cloud Premier Partner, Dev9 and their VP of Delivery / GCP Certified Architect , Mike Ensor, for a discussion and live demonstration on using Kubernetes to extract java microservices from monoliths. Learn about different technical approaches and the importance of bounded context in java microservices. Followed by a live demonstration of two primary extraction methods: Strangler Pattern and Service Extraction.

Key Takeaways:
-Importance of understanding bounded context in microservices
-Two demonstrable methods for microservice extraction
-Practical example of Kubernetes usage

RSVP: Attendance is limited to first 35 confirmed guests.

Speaker:
Mike Ensor - VP of Delivery / Google Certified Architect at Dev9, www.dev9.com
Mike is a hands-on software architect with 24 years of experience in cloud architectures, custom application development, e-commerce,, distributed systems and big data implementations. Throughout his career he has continually pushed the use of test-driven development, the principles of continuous delivery and emphasized the merits of Agile-based development. Mike has co-presented with Google / K8 luminaries such as Kelsey Hightower, Alan Naim and Carter Morgan.
how_to_find_us: (Breakside Brewery, Slabtown, Pendleton Room) Metered street & surface parking available nearby,  or walkable from the Portland Streetcar.

name: Google Cloud for Startups Mixer
description:
The Google Cloud for Startups Program is excited to invite you to our 2018 End of Summer mixer for Portland entrepreneurs, investors, and other members of the startup ecosystem.

Join us on Tuesday, September 4th from 6:00pm to 7:30pm for an opportunity to meet and mingle with fellow Portland-based 'startup junkies' as well as members of Google's startup teams.

Special Guest: Aaron Raddon, Co-Founder and CTO of Lytics will be speaking about their entrepreneurial journey, the key decisions made along the way, and why he chose to move Lytics to Google Cloud.

Light food and drinks will be served.

Please bring a valid ID.

RSVP: https://events.withgoogle.com/portland-startup-ecosystem/

If you have any questions, please email us at [masked].

name: Google & Wipster: Open House @ The Historic John Deere Building
description:
You're invited to Wipster and Google’s open house event!

Two of the most excited tech companies to hit PDX are forces for an evening of entertainment, video, networking, and to discuss the future of cloud collaboration

Come sip drinks at the new Wipster office, meet the teams behind the tech, network with other PDX leaders, and score awesome swag!

This is an open house event with a range of activities happening throughout the night, in a casual, fun, and informal setting.

Demo Room Pop-up Video Studio Smart Cloud Presentation Swag Raffle Food and Drinks Provided

Tuesday 16th October – Doors open at 5pm with the raffle and presentation at 6:30.

Wipster HQ – 215 SE Morrison St, Portland, OR.

https://go.wipster.io/wipster-google-pdx-open-house

name: Google Cloud + SoftServe Meet-up: Machine Learning Design, Demystified
description:
IMPORTANT: Please register on Eventbrite. This link will serve as the official RSVP.

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/google-cloud-softserve-meet-up-machine-learning-design-demystified-portland-tickets-53029585919

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Join us at Cambia Health in Portland for our latest meet-up, “Machine Learning Design, Demystified” for food, drinks, and discussion on machine learning architecture.

In this interactive session, you will learn about designing the architecture for ML systems via series of gamified interactive exercises. We will simulate state-of-the-art ML design systems by analyzing both business and technical requirements, selecting the best matching algorithms, and teaching how to validate early design decisions using rapid prototyping techniques.

Attendees are encouraged to think of an ML use case and bring it for discussion.

Don’t forget to register to secure your spot! Each attendee must be registered using their own name and contact info to attend this event. No on-site registrations will be permitted.
